page.title: 03MATHERN VILLAGE SCHOOL.
page.content: There is a little village in the corner of Gwent called Mathern. There lies our school which has 78 pupils aged four to eleven. In 1724,(260 years ago) a man called Charles Pratt left money in his will for a school to be built so that the "poore children of Matherne" could be educated "for ever". In school we have 3 computers, 2 televisions, a video recorder, record player and telephone. The lessons we have include Maths, English, Music, Physical Education, Art, Environmental Study Projects, Games and Swimming. We enjoy many activities like school trips, sports day, swimming galas, pantomimes, and special church services at Harvest Time, Christmas and at the end of the school year in July.
